title: Concussion
summary: A concussion, also known as a mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI), is a head injury that temporarily affects brain functioning.[10] Symptoms may include loss of consciousness (LOC); memory loss; headaches; difficulty with thinking, concentration or balance; nausea; blurred vision; sleep disturbances; and mood changes.[1] Any of these symptoms may begin immediately, or appear days after the injury.[1] Concussion should be suspected if a person indirectly or directly hits their head and experiences any of the symptoms of concussion.[11] It is not unusual for symptoms to last 2 weeks in adults and 4 weeks in children.[12][2] Fewer than 10% of sports-related concussions among children are associated with loss of consciousness.[13]
